page.title: 07Language,New Galloway
page.content: The natives of New Galloway, both young and old, still use many Broad Scots words. EXAMPLES OF SCOTS WORDS AND THEIR MEANINGS: gowk=simpleton; gang=to go; heuck=hedge knife; clout=cloth or rag; hippen=baby's nappy; wale= choose,select; steek the yet=close the door/gate; ahint=behind; mavis=a thrush; creel=basket; howdie=midwife; seugh=draught; plook=pimple; rowan=mountain ash; causy=cobble stone; chucky=white stone; kye=cattle; canny=careful; doo=pigeon; shoon=shoe; speer=to ask; aye=yes; greeting=crying; dwam=dreamy; sark=clothes; foonurt=cold; drookit=wet; to snek=to close; clecking=gathering.
